page.title: 05St.Ignatius Church
page.content: This church of England is 96 years old.About 120 people go to the church each Sunday,half live nearby whie others come from different parts of town.The bell ringers are from the congrgation.The Sunday service begins at 10.10 and ends at 12.00:they sing hymns and say prayers.The church has one vicar and a deacon is joining in June 1985.Behind the church is the three year old vicarage which is in keeping with the new housing estate nerby.Alongside the church is a new group of shops called St.Ignatius Precinct.Volunteers from the congregation display flowers and keep the church clean.A pilgrimage to Walsingham,Norfolk is made every year as 'Our Lady' was seen here.At one time the church doors were left open during the day-but now,due to vandalism they are kept locked.
